OKKSOWW6LJngI4ZMM8IuIg.text: Rehab is great. If you love burgers and don't mind taking an adventurous approach to your cuisine, then this is the place for you. From traditional burgers to burgers with two maple donuts as buns, this place has it all. Expect lots of options here, a fun environment, and a busy dining rooms, since it's on Mill Ave. There is a pretty generous happy hour with both drinks and food on the menu, so start your night out right and stop in at Rehab for a good dinner before a night of drinking!

TwVuh4ng3nmzFkMHCnedZQ.text: Came here on a Thursday at noon and the 3 of us were seated right away. 2 of us shared the PBJ and bacon burger with sweet potato tater tots!! It was soooo good. We all shared the pot brownie for dessert, also very good. I definitely recommend this place.

TCC2O8nTKeG_qC3RAM8PYw.text: This is one of my favorite places to grab lunch!   My boyfriend and I always start out with a basket of fries (half regular, half sweet potato). It's great because it comes with sauces - I think you get to choose three - and the fries are always so crispy and delicious. Sometimes we come JUST for the fries.   If you're feeling adventurous, try the mac n'cheese burger. It's cheesy and messy and might give you a heart attack on your way home (they don't call it Rehab for nothing), but it's soooo good.  Another thing I love is their Gluten Free buns - they don't crumble or fall apart while you're eating your burger, which can be hard to find.   The burgers are really rich in flavor, so I tend to split one with friends. It's usually really busy, but if there's a wait, it's worth your time! Parking isn't the best, but there's a lot nearby that you can park in and just walk over.

UC1txexC9lPQ1UNqfzkCLg.text: I've come to this location over a dozen times. It truthfully depends on where you sit I've noticed on how well or how terrible your service is. I've had one gentleman that is amazing every time I've gotten him. Every other waiter has been ok to horrible. The food however? Amazing. This is my second worst experience I've had at this location. Today I came in, after waiting over 10 minutes for someone to ask for our order, we asked a random waitress & inquired about the weekend special burger. The waitress had no idea there was even a special burger today. The worst part was when she asked who our original waiter was, she didn't know, turns around & simply blurts out "what do you want?" I'm not a waiter or waitress but the tone of voice which this was said in, atrocious to say the least. I drive all the way from Laveen to come eat here the times I do. This may very well be my last. Even with the food being as amazing as it is.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Tempe, AZ, United States

rYYw-3Fee81EnR68Rg434w.text: This place rocked my palate. This I had the Philly burger. It was one of the best burgers I've tasted in my entire life. I don't like sweet potatoes but I saw every table in the entire restaurant had them so I went for the sweet potato tots. Epic. Highly recommended.  Eat here at least once.  I will definitely be back for more!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Tempe, AZ, United States. Philly burger

YqXsSRooor2e8j4lPdIk9g.text: The food and drinks are exceptional. The chicken wings medium hotness were perfectly prepared and delicious. We ordered 5 different burgers all outstanding the French fries are addicting, the beef is fresh and was cooked as ordered.  If visiting the Phoenix area this is the place not to miss

W_WNYcmRSTiSjlFZFKjCew.text: Great service and ambiance set the tone when walking in. We had incredible service from, Jet!! In conversation, we explained to him we had heard so much about this establishment and really did not want to be dissapointed because it was hyped up so much. He took that as a challenge to make us understand and appreciate the hype! Jet guided us with great recommendations, told us what sauces to pair with the frys or tater tots and burgers, brought an extra sauce out for us to try and they were all great. We ordered the jalapeno popper burger, pulled pork sandwhich and Nelson con verde pollo, appetizer.....it was all delicious! The hamburger buns make such a difference on a good burger or even pulled pork sandwhich, this place is spot on! Glad we tried it and we will be back!

It really is a shame because I love the concept. I was looking forward to coming back and trying other things on the menu and the service was great.

nkf0PvruKD3LR_zG0Xd7Nw.text: I don't know how this place isn't rated higher! The burgers are amazing and the staff is always friendly. The sweet potato tater tots are my favorite things on the menu. Its a causal place with good burgers and the first place I take people from out of town to. The burgers are really big! I usually can't finish the smaller one!

kC8d2NDrMpTEMLSFmvYz3Q.text: Good vibes all around at Rehab! I loved the atmosphere of the beach bar, decorations were spot on. The service was ok. Our waitress was decent - she kept the drinks full and always asked how we were doing when she walked by. She seemed a tad stressed, but rightfully so as she was also helping a table of around 20 people. I was craving mac and cheese, and decided to go for it on the mac and cheese burger. DELICIOUS! The fries, burger - everything! Definitely planning to come back and experience the food again!

4zvmUEVTsGWY82qjzndr6g.text: Rehab burger is my favourite burger joint in the Valley. My first visit was at the Scottsdale location and I was so excited to see signs for this place opening. I waited and waited... but still no burgers. Finally, months after they started construction, they were open!!! I was thrilled. I had high expectations and they've been met with every visit.  First the Food: Every burger provides mouthfuls of flavour and happiness. My favourite is the PB+J+Sriracha burger. It's messy, but it is AMAZING. I could eat this everyday. But... I probably shouldn't. Right? Also high on my least: the mac and cheese burger, the Hawaiian burger, and the poppers burger. All so good.   There are two sizes. If you're into sharing, get the bigger burger and split it. It'll be more than enough food.   Pretzel buns are the way to go. Dense and chewy, and oh so delicious.   Also, sweet potato tots? Just say yes. Unless you like normal potatoes. They're good too.  Service: they're dressed in Hawaiian shirts. These guys are chill.   Come and get a burger, you won't regret it.

rj9C8lj8C8MaA2JFXoq9QA.text: This is probably the worst place I've been to. They don't have ingredients to make what they have on their menu. The servers aren't friendly. The food takes forever to come out. I don't recommend and will not be coming here again. Over priced for what they deliver.

N1R4T3nlmF64QzBJUdkwNg.text: Awesome place for burgers in Tempe!  I've been to the Rehab burger in Scottsdale, and this one in Tempe does not disappoint as well! In fact, it's a lot more spacious than the original.  We ordered a couple of burgers and I also got the signature spicy Mac n cheese! Everything was phenomenal!!!! The service was great!  If there is one thing I urge you to try it's the spicy Mac and cheese. The flavor of it is amazing, and it's actually not that spicy! I would highly recommend going here again!   Tips: 1) get the sweet potato tater tots, they're the best!  2) parking here is scarce since it's on Mill, you may need to find a spot anywhere and just walk here 3) get the spicy Mac n cheese, it's sooo good! If you get the "rehab" size, it's definitely easily shared with 5-6 people

pH8Yn5H4bVtNddop-FiAmQ.text: Good atmosphere. Excellent food. Good service. Thanks waitress Cassidy!! Definitely would suggest to a friend or even a stranger!!!!

rECOo6LLwYUirfeaDTPuJQ.text: I'm really disappointed because I've heard this place be hyped up so many times. I'm sure a good experience can be had here, but we did not have one.   We got to the restaurant around 8 on a weekday, a little close to closing for me, but it wasn't busy & they took us. We sat & it took about 5ish minutes for someone to come over & take our drink order which is pretty average for me. We took until our server brought the drinks back to order because we were a little indecisive. After we ordered (Know Poblano Burger & Veggie Noogie), the wait began. In total wait time, we sat for close to 55 minutes waiting on our food. The average wait time is usually 23 minutes (and my fiance being in the business knows places usually push for that). About 40 minutes in, we asked how much longer the food would be (let me say in a really nice tone) and the server just told us when it's ready. I really wanted to leave & just go to Whataburger, but I was trying not to be a jerk. Our drinks didn't get refilled until we had our food on the table. The food wasn't the worst, but I wasn't impressed. The wait time had already created a lackluster experience. The fries were cold on both of our plates, the eggplant on my sandwich was so tough I just ended up removing it, but his burger was fine.   I don't think I would ever return as a sit down customer, maybe takeout, but that's pretty out of the way for us, so I don't see us driving out there to come home with cold food (especially since we could've gotten cold food there).

gxhhLvkgT9JdEF27_7sUeQ.text: Let me tell you, I have been to Rehab Burger Therapy multiple times now and I have yet to be disappointed. Everything tastes so fresh and delicious and everyone is so friendly and down to earth. We have been served by Madelyn today and she was very friendly and an amazing server. A few days ago, I was served my Keara and she was also very friendly and amazing. Overall, you can tell everything is fresh and the servers are awesome.

SmqUK6wv1cRwaB_7-JQ5wQ.text: Horrible service, we come here in my husbands birthday, we wait for one hour, we decided to take the food to go because we have other plans, we pay for 2 hamburgers and appetizers 40 dlls + tip and in top of that are food was just trash, canned mushrooms in my hamburgers are you f#%* and frozen fries. DONT EVER GO THERE.

qAg25EGlkjI0cufaAlSsbg.text: Finally got to experience this establishment. My bf loved his hangover burger. I ordered the spicy Mac and cheese with chicken and it was just ok. It was dry and not that spicy.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Tempe, AZ, United States. The spicy Mac and cheese was dry and not that spicy. I prefer Mac and cheese much more cheesier.

f4ILWL7mm2Wl8biJDefR6g.text: I was craving a burger--a REAL burger--and Rehab was everything I wanted and more. It is truly rare to have one's expectations met so well!  Every menu item looks great, but I needed something spicy, so I went with the Know Poblano burger, with manchego cheese, actual, actually grilled poblano peppers, and sauteed onions. Because this wasn't enough spice for me, and I felt brave, I went with the beef chorizo patty.   It was everything I wanted and more.  The chorizo itself was surprisingly lean without being dry. It was basically a burger loaded--LOADED with spice. Like, it only burned my tongue a little bit, but the whole thing was so full of seasoning that the steam would make my eyes water every time I lifted it to take a bite. That's not a complaint, that's freaking amazing. On the side were *perfect* fries seasoned with garlic salt, as well as some sriracha aioli.   I washed it down with a large margarita, which was discounted thanks to Thursday's all-day happy hour. It was definitely not weak, and for sure not too sweet. Spectacular, just like everything else.   If you're not into (red) meat, there are legit fish tacos (I tried a bite! They're good enough!), as well as veggie burgers.   So there. You have no excuses to avoid this amazing, amazing restaurant. Enjoy!

jlh19OtC2akBC1_zNWXfdQ.text: Rehab Burger Therapy is fun.  The atmosphere is very bright and friendly and you feel good as soon as you walk in.  The service is quick as well.  The food is great.  I had the hangover burger and it was fantastic.  The food is in no short supply either, as I was unable to finish my meal.  Prices are appropriate for what you get.  It's not a steal, but it's not overpriced either.  Overall, very happy with my experience.

Hfdrd1utAZBPvV6hnDA6Cg.text: Burger was great! My family really enjoyed the meal on our last day of vacation. Drinks were great too! I had the strawberry margarita. The waitress was also really nice!

yoEpL6zGO4rJXu5IMtC_KA.text: My boyfriend and I dined here for lunch after several friends recommended the place to us, so we had very high expectations. The menu was very extensive and nearly overwhelming, and our waitress had come by twice to take our order but I wasn't ready yet, so I felt a bit rushed and quickly chose the PB&J and bacon burger.  However upon biting into the burger, I realized there was something very important I had missed in the item description - the burger has quite a significant amount of sriracha sauce on it. I have no tolerance for spicy food whatsoever, so after that one bite I asked if I could get another one and the waitress happily obliged. Now, I fully understand that was my fault for not reading the full description before ordering, and while I think it's rather silly to put sriracha on a burger with peanut butter and jelly to begin with and makes a rather terrible combination, still my bad.  So the waitress brought out a new burger minus the sriracha and it was good, my boyfriend enjoyed his burger, and all was well.... until we got the bill. They'd charged us for TWO of the PB&J burgers, which was each about $11. Also keep in mind the waitress took the first burger as soon as I reordered, so it's not even like we got to keep it - we had to pay an extra $11 for one bite of a burger I couldn't eat. If we'd known we'd be charged for both, which the waitress neglected to inform us of, then we would've kept the first one and my boyfriend would've had it later or something since he's fine with spicy food. Anyone who has worked in a restaurant before knows that if a customer dislikes a meal and needs it fixed or redone, the decent thing to do is to take the first one off their bill. I've had years of experience in customer service, both as an employee and a customer, and this is a very basic practice. But if Rehab Burger Therapy is going to be that money-hungry then we won't be coming back, and many of our friends who initially recommended this place were appalled as well and have also been scared off.

tiKaIB6ZcVUvWni2GcZeaw.text: Great food. The chicken wings were good. Loved the hangover burger with a fired egg, bacon, and a hatch chile. The sweet potato tots were good as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Tempe, AZ, United States. The hangover burger was great. The chicken wings was good too. Love the sweet potato tots. Would totally come back when I&#39;m in town.

VCaKKGu85AwKNyFHD8gI7A.text: Hair in my fries...and the burger was just okay. I've been here a few times and enjoyed it but now I think I'm going to pass. Not a fan.

sh7KDAUmcjkOm7zgQxhcGg.text: This is the first time I have ever been to this location but I will not be back. There are so many choices in the area that it won't be hard to find something better.  The food was okay. We got the green chili chicken dip and wings. The dip was salty but the wings were a good size. My 2 stars comes from my server Madelyn. My boyfriend and I got our dip first and then our wings a few minutes later. Within about five minutes of us getting our order Madelyn dropped off our check and said she'd take it when we were ready. We had barely touched our food and my boyfriend had only drank 3/4 of his beer. He had planned on getting another beer but Madelyn made it clear she was done taking care of us. If she had told me that it was the end of her shift and she wanted to go home I would have respected that and tabbed out. Instead she made us feel awkward about not finishing our meals and paying her faster. I've worked in the service industry for 20 years and it's been a long time since I've felt this unappreciated as a guest.

MiweF2p6W4cCkmrEO-fmRQ.text: Best burgers in town in my opinion! I've had it a few times now and am never disappointed.

sljHYR5fqTEH8AP6Q9SE_w.text: Not impressed.  The burgers were terrible pretty sure they were Costco patties.  Is everyone drunk when they eat here?  The service was terrible and we sent burgers back once but second round was bad also.  The meat did not taste fresh.  I so wanted to love thr pb&j but big fail.  I think the one in Scottsdale is different owner.

tkZhv_2IbWPdlBUZ09LAbA.text: Very fine food. I've had several different burgers off the menu including the Spicy Mac-and-cheese burger, peanut butter and jelly burger, and the jalapeno popper burger. All are very good. And servers have always been excellent and very nice. Only reason I'm giving 4 stars instead of five is as follows: very limited draft beer selection, I like to go through the week when it's slower as it is in dead center of a college town and can be crazy on the weekend. So even being slow during the week the service can be somewhat slow at times. Through it all, very fine place to eat.

5dN6rszkvisb8S4_zjjJXw.text: Great burgers, sides, and staff. Went here for lunch with my family today and we will be going back for sure. This is a family friendly restaurant with reasonably priced foods. I had the PBJ and bacon burger and it tasted exactly how I imagined. A+

CvNTEcm-DE3PJZOuWWotbw.text: My family loved this place!  Cade was an excellent waiter, and we had a great time.  The dessert was fabulous, and the burgers were awesome.

wGmAiwhUSYeqQZLowtsfiQ.text: Fantastic burgers and service. The wait is usually a little long but for great food that's understandable.

ru13eSo03logPvB1DlJQEQ.text: I stumbled upon this place through yelp and I'm glad I did. Great service, the bartender recommended the PBJ&Bacon burger on pretzel bun, amazing! Definitely coming back next time I'm in town!

PP29vy7AmKhoF7FWk-34iw.text: A good burger but not great. Lousy lemonade didn't care for the fries. Colleague sent her burger it was way over cooked. They did offer to replace it it and took off the bill but not a place I'd visit agains.

li_OvC_tkNKP-Bjy_kd8_A.text: One of the best burgers I've ever had!  Being very partial to the burgers, I sometimes forget all of the many other options available to order. They have appetizers, 7 different Salads for entrees, wings, Pastas (The Mac & Cheese is AMAZING!) and then...2 1/2 pages of delicious hamburgers!!  They have 2 sizes of hamburgers.  The "Rehab" is 10 oz of ground beef and the "Relapse" burger is 5 oz of ground beef - the absolute perfect size for ladies. My faves..."Mushroom and Swiss burger" and the "Spicy Mac and Cheese burger".  They also have a Veggie burger, Turkey burger, and multiple sandwiches.  The restaurant itself is a very laid back vibe. There is seating inside and outside and these beautiful Spring nights make sitting outside an even better experience. Wait staff are very friendly and seem to appear when you need them, yet don't hover at your table. All in all...GO! Go eat one of the best burgers in town. You'll be glad you did!!

iix1e6ChzTMAQjuVGfNImA.text: Just ate at the Tempe location for the first time. The food was killer, the ambience was chill, and the service was top notch.  Our server Dominic was excellent...his recommendations were on point and he was super attentive.  We brought our 2 year old daughter, and although they didn't have a kid's menu, Dominic suggested several menu items that would be appropriate for a toddler. The portions are huge...some people in our party ordered the 10oz burger when the 5oz burger would have sufficed. Other than being too full, we have no complaints.  We will most definitely be back.

uB850n5xV8SugPGw7MgJKQ.text: Nice place in Tempe just off the beaten path of mill ave. Burgers are good and staff is friendly. Walked in 15 min before kitchen closed and still got great service and a fast turn around on my order. Not a lot of the college crowd so you can actually hear yourself think

LGBxyKZ3XXu6PcncKbOSHg.text: Hi had a terrible experience dining at this location.  We ordered bloody mary's and the spicy one was not spicy, the horseradish one contained little if any horseradish, the mixer was watered down and the pour was light.  When we ordered a double for round two the waitress spilt most of the booze on the floor.  The chili cheese fries....  huge portion of not delicious.  Canned cheese product, kidney beans, and marinara sauce.  We nibbled on these for 30 minutes waiting on our burgers while they severed the rest of the restaurant.  By the time our main course arrived, we were so unhappy they comped our meal and we left.  My hamburger was raw.  I did not eat it, but I shudder to think what would have happened to me if I did.  Beware the coleslaw.  We took one bite and decided there was something sketchy about it.  We had been looking forward to trying this place for months and it was the worst dining experience of my life.  We only went here because the wait in Scottsdale was an hour plus.  There's a reason.

cmjzK-Ns0WfNkjLODlC7FQ.text: Heavy burgers.  Not the best if you want something healthyish.  Probably 800 calories per burger

unZVrTzRsTCtXUahnipsXg.text: I've been to the one in Scottsdale and had a pretty good experience, so decided to try this location as it's closer. Burgers and sides are great! Service was pretty awful. I think our server was new as he kept forgetting things and the tables around us seemed to be thinking the same thing. Besides the sub-par service, I was really looking forward to trying the pot brownie dessert and it looks and sounds delicious. It was very disappointing. The brownie tasted like something you'd buy frozen and microwave :/ I wouldn't say that I will never go here again, but don't see myself going out of my way. Definitely worth a visit for some good burgers if you've never been!

lkIZqsbEdRtuFl8M78SO5Q.text: Had lunch on Wednesday- not crowded at all. Service was very slow..25 minutes for food to arrive. I had the Tony Montana, it tasted good but was very dry. Sweet potato tots are excellent

o0s6h3DXXQU8bkRZfmE6kQ.text: I've been to the location in Scottsdale and finally made it out to the Tempe location off Mill Ave. This is absolutely my all time favorite burger place. From the fries and sweet po"TOT"oes to the BLT's and AMAZING burgers, great beer selection, plus the extremely friendly staff at both locations...this place is the #1 burger spot. I still cannot believe my favorite burger that I now always order is the PB&J Bacon burger...yes, I thought it would have been gross...now I can't NOT order it! Try it!

ygleLheCnY5dwr32vFDgMg.text: I am so excited about this location. I had an out of town guest come to town and I knew I wanted to have him try a Rehab burger. I was worried about driving to Scottsdale on a Saturday night, and having it be packed with a long wait. I was pleasantly surprised when I learned there was a location only a few blocks away from where we were! I called to ask what the wait looked like and was told they were busy- but there were a few spots at the bar open. Kassie at the bar was so kind on the phone, and since we were on our way, and two blocks away, she said she would hold a couple spots for us. I was shocked, that was so thoughtful of her, and it made me feel taken care of, and welcome before I ever stepped through the doors. This location exceeded my already high expectations, and it didn't disappoint in any way. The PBJ burger is my all time favorite and can't be missed. Amazing food! Perfection in the burgers all the way. The staff and vibe are so welcoming, and the customer service was simply awesome. Ian was our server and even brought us a small side of his favorite sauce to try for dipping the yummy sweet potato tots.***!! It's the little things that make the biggest impact. Special thanks to Kim, Ian, and Kassie- You made our dinner date perfect! We will be back- I'll be dreaming of pretzel buns, tots, and PB until we do:)

cVUN0czqpj5S8mIQ9lxvyQ.text: We went to the Tempe location recently on a Friday night at 6-7 pm. We were excited to try this place. I love burgers!! The place is fun looking.  After being seated and given menus our waitress asked is what we wanted to drink. When I asked what was in a tropical named drink she said "I don't know , probably tropically things like,pineapple or coconut". Now I think the menu should break down signature drinks but it does not, but the waitress should know. Now I know it was a new location and she's likely new, so I would have had no issue w her saying, sorry I am new, I'm not a 100%sure what's in it, so let me ask the bartender (now this would have been VERY simple  as we were at a table RIGHT next to the bar) she completely blew us off and did not even attempt to figure out what the drink was made of. I assume restaurants mAke a good profit off of the alcohol. We did not order any due to this. Next, I order a burger on brioche.... sorry they were out and only had pretzel or wheat . This seemed quite odd to me as this was early Friday night and I assume brioche is pretty popular. I didn't end up ordering a burger due to that. I know it sounds picky but I would think a burger restaurant would have that and it was what I wanted. The prices were good but service was not. Sadly I left hungry and disappointed. Maybe we will try again later.

-u_LHcOKdJAVeYs1WKa-pA.text: Probably 2 1/2 stars.  Given all the 4-5 star reviews it is likely a bunch of college student reviews.  The burgers look great in the pictures.  They are just OK.  We had a Hatch chili burger, bacon bleu with pretzel bun and a chicken sandwich.  They were cooked as ordered but the beef, toppings nor bread had any great flavor to speak of.  Not bad, just not good. Service was timely and polite and friendly .  The atmosphere - specifically the menu design is very chain restaurant-like (hokey).  Looks like a good place to have a couple beers.   The bigger issue was the staff dress.  The hostess was awful.  She was wearing an ill-fitting tank top and tights.  There was another waitress who was wearing a sleeveless t-shirt.  But she also had something tying the shirt back in such a way that her back was showing off a large tattoo but also ridiculous side-boob.  Trashy in general but disgusting as a food server.  Not sure if everyone got cold suddenly or the manager made them cover up as these two had jackets on when we left.

i98HHsVpsb5CIwggo8XsHA.text: The food is usually good here but should not take a whole hour for a burger. UDL0A6dK4rriN8UhHwJxaw.text: I think I may need to go to Rehab after eating this burger!  Just kidding.  I like the way they have a Hawaiian theme going on in here.  Guess everyone would like to rehab in Hawaii!  When I arrived, the host asked how many were in my party, I told him 9.  He said he's never seated a party that large before.  Hmmm.  Ok.  So, after discussing it with another person, they arranged to seat us just past the bar.  It worked out great!  They do have patio seating which might have been a better option, but I don't like any amount of warm weather, so I chose to be seated indoors.  The place was fairly easy to find, but it is located almost right next to the border of the ASU Campus. There's a parking garage on 6th Street (not free) if you can't find street parking.    To dive into this place, figuring out what you want may be a feat in itself!  They offer so many types of burgers, some sound super crazy!  Don't worry, if you don't want a burger, they do offer salads, wings, pastas, and other sandwiches.  The Rehab size is a 10oz burger and the Relapse size is a 5 oz burger.  The cost difference is only $2.00, so it's worth it to get the Rehab size.  The burgers are just overloaded with so much stuff, it is almost easier to deconstruct it while eating it!  It's like getting an extra side!  I got a Hatch Burger (Relapse) with Ghost Pepper Jack Cheese.  They will make substitutions for you, or at least they did for me.  It was a very good burger because it was just like a cheeseburger with a chili, not over the top with toppings!  Everyone else seemed to enjoy their burgers, too!  You can change up or request extra sauces.  The Wasabi Mayo was killer!  Went extremely well with the Sweet PoTOTers!  Mmmmm!!  Here's a short funny... my Dad usually eats small items that are soft to chew.  He decided that a Tuna Salad Sammy would be harmless.  It was the tallest sandwich that was served!  Yes, it was soft, but he had to eat it with a fork to manage it better!    Being right off the ASU Campus, there is a bar in here, too.  I didn't take a look to see what all they offered, but I'm sure you can get something to suit you.  They do take a little while to get your food to you, but it wasn't a terribly long wait.  We kept busy talking and visiting with each other.  This would be a great place to come to if you are in the area!

jVCLBnErku0EEip3eLoB6A.text: If they tried to make me go to Rehab Burger I might say Yes Yes Yes! I actually tried to go to the Scottsdale location a few months back but the wait to get a table was so long that we decided to eat somewhere else. We were in the area and saw that the Tempe location had just opened so we figured we should check it out!  The location is a bit hidden, right next to the Brickyard garage exit off of 6th Street. There is outdoor and indoor seating and in the winter they have heaters out if you do decide to eat on the patio. It was fairly busy when we came here on Saturday in the afternoon but we were able to get a seat with no wait.   The menu has an extensive selection of burgers and drinks. They have a daily happy hour from 11-6 which includes discounted drinks. Every burger can be made into a 5 oz relapse size or 10 oz rehab size, and there are multiple protein options, such as beef, turkey, and veggie patty. Feeling in a spicy mood, I opted for the ghost burger, labeled as such due to the inclusion of ghost pepper cheese. I tried some of the chili cheeseburger as well.  Since it was pretty busy it took some time for our orders to get out to our table. Service was good though as we were waiting and drinks were refilled as needed. The plates were impressive looking. The execution though left something to be desired. Our burgers were supposed to be medium rare but came out more like medium to medium well. The burger itself had a dense tough texture, not very juicy, and didn't have a lot of flavor in it aside from a faint taste of char from the grill. I did enjoy the guacamole but the cheese wasn't fully melted in the center of the burger and had a slight grainy texture. The ghost pepper in it was actually not too spicy. I'd say it was about the spiciness of a jalapeno. The pretzel bun was decent but I didn't really enjoy it with my particular burger.   The chili cheeseburger was admirably smothered in a large amount of chili. The taste itself was OK, nothing spectacular, and I had the same problem with the beef patty being too densely brick-like in texture and lacking in flavor.  The fries were light and crisp, dusted with some seasoned salt and very plentiful.  Since it was so busy they seemed a bit rushed for us to finish and get our table cleared. Everyone here though was friendly and attentive.  I'll give them another try; maybe another type of burger will taste better.

mH_F7zsvMTMyq_BrX9XJOA.text: This is one of the best burger places I've been. Every time we are in Scottsdale we come here for burgers.  Believe it or not the peanut butter and jelly with bacon burger is to die for. It is the best tasting burger. I make it at home too but it's not the same as Rehab burger. Highly recommend trying it you will not be disappointed.

_tn7n_SWOjWCRG61NPaVNw.text: Absolutely horrible. From start to finish, virtually everything was a disaster.   When we first arrived, we we're promptly seated and given our menus. Our waiter came over a few minutes later to take our drink orders. Upon receiving my drink, I noticed that the glass I was given was dirty. I informed the waiter took it back to get me another one. At this time my wife had ordered a beer as well. I received my beer fairly quickly, but she did not receive hers. We had then reminded him of this, he said he would get on this.   We then went to ordering. We ordered a quesadilla for an appetizer, two hamburgers with veggie Patty's, and an order of their spicy Mac & Cheese without the bacon. After putting in our order, we reminded the waiter AGAIN that my wife hadn't received her beer.   The quesadilla had came, and my wife still hadn't received her beer. We did not have an silverware or napkins, so we also asked for these. Finally, my wife's beer had arrived. She ordered a pint of Blue Moon, which usually comes garnished with an orange slices, but there was not one on it. This isn't the most important thing, but was disappointing.   Our burgers and side of Mac and Cheese came maybe 5 minutes after getting the appetizer. This sounds like fast service, but we were expecting to have more time to enjoy the rest of the appetizer before our burgers came. So now our burgers had to get cold while we finished our quesadilla. I instantly noticed the Mac and Cheese had bacon in it, so we had to send it back. We also noticed that the buns we order on our burgers we're on the wrong burger. At this time we still hadn't received napkins or silverware.   The waiter finally came back with the Mac and Cheese, and silverware!   After taking one bite of the Mac and Cheese, we had realized that it was unedible. We had asked the waiter if they microwave their Mac and Cheese, he informed us that they don't, but it really tasted like they did. As far as the burgers go, they did not taste at all what we we're hoping for. For $15 a burger, these we're a HUGE disappointment.   Overall, I do not think we will ever be back. We would try another location, since they have multiple in the valley, but at this point I would just have to say to AVOID.

Gjh0spyAzEMxlQiEsS6L0g.text: Been here several times including the one in Scottsdale, this is the first bad meal I've ever had at this restaurant. I always take my out of town guests to the restaurant to show off what Arizona is all about, but tonight the food was just not good, I did not want to complain to the waitress because the service was good as usual but the burgers just did not taste good. The service was over the top compared to the previous establishment just a few doors down.  We tried the green chili burger and it was delicious.  I was very impress with everything and the price for a 1/2 pound burger is around 10 bucks, which you can split with someone easily, it's more than enough.  Very happy with everything and I will be back.

qND5Pvu-U5WumjFDFWGqCA.text: A Tiki Lounge meets burger joint! What a cool concept! Rehab was pretty quiet when were were there for an early dinner. The TVs had a mix of aquarium scenes and people are awesome videos playing.  I had the mushroom swiss burger and the fries. The seasoning blend they use on the fries is killer. Add some of the Aioli sauce and you have a wild flavor combo. The burger was cooked perfectly and the buns are so fresh and tasty.  For the gluten free crowd they have several options. You can do a lettuce wrap or they have a gluten free bun too.   My biggest regret is filling up on the burger and fries. I would love to go back and try the pot brownies. I bet they are worth the pain of over eating.

SLRIM7co1oU1u3uYWUg56A.text: I was in the mood for a hamburger and I dragged my husband to this joint this past weekend.  The festival was going on, so we had a bit of a walk to the restaurant, which was not a big deal, and it helped to increase our hunger.  We were pleasantly surprised by this place.  The decor is fun.  The service was super friendly.  Got sat just as we walked in, and even though the place was hoppin', our meal was served quite fast.  We both order the BYOB (build your own burger).  Mine was piled high and cooked to perfection (i always ask for medium).  The right amount of the toppings I picked, and the sauces added to the flavor, of course.  Did not order any special drinks or desserts.  The burgers were so big that it was enough for our meal.  For a restaurant near the college, it was not bad (as far as rowdiness).  It might become our favorite place for a hamburger from now on. :)

fPnJ8dUNmqVKXTDQJMQG9g.text: Located off Mill Avenue this burger joint brings in a fun crowd .. outside patio seating has the much needed misters or plenty of indoor seating ..   We were invited to a private taco party and I am so happy we made it .. our group shared fish, chicken & pork tacos (only the fish tacos are on the menu), huge guacamole, salsa & pico de gallo.. we ate family style ..   The battered cod fish tacos were my favorite .. served with cabbage & a sprinkle of cotija cheese, tomato, cilantro and salsa.. squeeze of lime .. yum  Summer drink specials were very good.. the strawberry crush with jack Daniels was my fav..  Servers took excellent care of our group.. looking forward to our next visit... thanks again for allowing us to celebrate at your spot!!

I1Y0QqM8OPvUso9oG8Pktg.text: Finally went to this place after many people told me to check it out.  We left thinking about all the people we plan to bring back. There are all the wild and crazy burger options that fit the needs of everyone. The most popular burger is the PBJ burger and my husband had it-- was good he said! I tried the veggie burger with the onion rings and BBQ sauce topper. I liked it! The veggie burger is a fried panko bread crumb and black bean patty. It was a bit hard to judge the flavor since it was doused in BBQ sauce (which is how I like it), but I do wish it weren't fried.   Tip for kids: They don't have a kid's menu, but you can order half orders of PBJ or grilled cheese (what we ordered, and also mac'n'cheese and other items I can't remember). They are HUGE portions and I would've been full on the half order of grilled cheese or PBJ! The even come with fries and were only like $3.25 each.   I changed my mind and upgraded my fries to Jamaican corn at the last minute because I saw it come out on another person's plate (was DELISH, btw) and they brought me that WITH the fries at no additional charge. Super kind of them considering I was the one who made the mistake in ordering late.  The portions are huge, the food is pretty good and the prices are super reasonable considering that burger is very likely to serve as two meals for you!  Can't wait to head back!

XrEgInW3CaUt58S7P69y0Q.text: I feel terrible writing this review as I have long been a fan of rehab. I dine often at the Scottsdale location and order delivery through grub hub often. Generally there are no issues. Tonight was another story.   I ordered a bacon bleu cheese burger through grub hub, and upon arrival, I noticed that between the buns there was only a patty. Nothing more. Upon contacting grub hub, they spoke to the restaurant and were advised that the bacon and bleu cheese was inside the burger.  Ok cool. The description was wrong on grub hub. It didn't say anything about it being stuffed. But I'm cool with that. Bacon and bleu cheese stuffed burgers are some of my favorite burgers to make.  I look at the patty again, and still don't think it looks right. I work with meat on a daily basis, and I have made a lot of burgers (stuffed and not) during my time. I proceed to open the burger and examine it. Not a shred of bacon or bleu cheese. I'm very familiar with rehab's regular pattys and this was one of them.   I contacted grub hub again, and they reached out to the restaurant. They came back to tell me that the manager would not issue a refund for the burger I was incredibly unhappy with. I explained to them that neither of the components that make up the bacon bleu burger were included, but that say that there was nothing they could do as the manager would not allow a refund.  I work for one of the highest rated restaurants on Yelp, and we would never treat a guest like that. Even if they were clearly wrong. I'm not trying to scam them for a free burger. I love rehab and love supporting local business, but tonight I feel like the customer service ball was dropped.  Just finished eating the burger after I added some ingredients at home. Didn't taste any bacon or bleu cheese at all.  I don't see myself repeating my business there again soon.

QY9kHNBweBmxI3z8U9q-YA.text: This place is is the best! I had a veggie portobello mushroom burger, vegan style (I'm not vegan, but try to eat more plants). My server brought out 4 vegan sauces, but I found I didn't need to add sauce, as the mushroom had a nice marinade. The burger was packed with fresh veggies. It was served with a side of sweet potato tots. The portion was so huge, that I'd recommend sharing dinner so you can share a milkshake for dessert. Mmm.

-poqtvRfPfNc1GEYc-vmDQ.text: It's not often the BF and I find a place to eat we both enjoy. I'm vegetarian and gluten free while he's a Bacon, Bacon, Bacon, Beef, Potatoes and any other kind of red meat sorta guy. Anyhow, this place is perfect for us! He ordered the PB&J Bacon Burger (which he absolutely loved) and I ordered the Veggie Nuggie with a gluten free bun (very filling and delicious). There are many great menu options for both of us to choose from, the service was great and the atmosphere was relaxed and welcoming. I highly recommend Rehab!

Tip: unless you're really hungry or have a big appetite, the single patty "relapse" size is plenty filling.  Short verdict: the hype about how good the burgers are accurate.  The fries are average.  I thought the sweet potato taters were better than the fries with a crispy coating covering the soft interior.  The many positive reviews left by other Yelpers are spot on. 5wKpq-WFkQeTvOrXEWtcXQ.text: Spending a couple of days in Tempe AZ with my Honey for a conference and stoked to be without the kids and with time to catch up on Yelp!  I have family in the area that loves this burger joint and was super excited to give it a whirl. It has a casual vibe similar to Islands (one of my all time fave burger spots).  We happened to come in during happy hour and imbibed on a couple of cocktails. I had the Margatini ($8) which is made with a shot of Patron, fresh lime juice and a splash of love. Not sure what the splash of love was- I'm guessing bubbly water?   My fella got the Mike Tai ($7) which is a classic mai tai. Happy hour prices on these particular cocktails are $2 off.   We both had a hard time choosing a burger since the menu is pretty extensive. I settled on the Hangover Burger which you can order in a 10 oz. patty (Rehab size) or the 5 oz. patty (Relapse size). You can also substitute any Rehab burger with a turkey burger, grilled chicken breast, a beef chorizo patty or veggie burger at no extra charge.   I ended choosing the Relapse Hangover Burger ($13.75) which comes with a fried egg, bacon, Colby jack cheese, and hatch green chili. The burger was really tasty, but in hindsight I played it pretty safe and wish I had been a bit more adventurous since there are some really interesting burgers on the menu!   My husband ordered the Relapse Hawaiian burger. ($10.75) It came with a patty topped with Black Forest ham, Swiss cheese, grilled pineapple and a side of Teriyaki aioli. He didn't really care for this one and misread the side of aioli thinking it came drizzled with teriyaki sauce. I would've made the same mistake based on the name of the burger alone. I had a few bites of this one and it was just okay, he had half my burger and liked mine better.   Overall, it was a good burger place to try. I'm  tempted to give it another shot before we leave. May have to talk my fella into it first!   FYI The Relapse size burger patty isn't as photo-worthy as the Rehab size keep that in mind when ordering. Lol ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Tempe, AZ, United States. The 5 oz. Relapse Hawaiian Burger- topped w/Black Forest ham, Swiss cheese, grilled pineapple and side of teriyaki aioli. ($10.75)
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Tempe, AZ, United States. The 5 oz. Relapse Hangover Burger- fried egg, Colby jack cheese bacon and hatch green chili ($13.75)

9N5K5jPF03vI6rb1ayTZaQ.text: Was in the area recently on business and all I can say is please bring Rehab Burger Therapy to California!!  I went for dinner with a colleague and we looked over the menu choices and were quite surprised at first. Peanut butter Jelly and Mac and cheese burger were some of the choices! We were stumped between the two and which one to go with so we each got the opposite and spilt it in half! The saying ," Oh so wrong, but oh so right!" absolutely applied to these burgers! All the different flavors somehow just went well with each other! The peanut butter was a melty consistency against the meat with just enough jelly. The macaroni my personal favorite was actually really good macaroni alone, and amazing inside the burger! If you're in the area and wanting a really good burger with a twist definitely give them a try!

I always get stuck on which burger to order and since I've had a PB&J burger at a different restaurant, I decided to get a different burger but my coworker got the Rehab PB&J burger. 67ip_hQPoMs72TIN0gvnWA.text: I'm so glad I gave Rehab Burger another try after my less-than-stellar experience on my 24th birthday.   This time, I came during peak dinner time on a Friday, and I went again on a Saturday for their special maple bacon donut burger! Both times we were served without a hitch. We had great customer service and I was really REALLY happy with my food. Their sweet potato tots are so good and I love that you can order TONS of sauce.  I am meticulously checking their social media to see if there are any fun special burgers coming up, because I don't want to miss out! They usually have a special or unique burger that's only available on Saturday/Sunday. (I learned the hard way that they don't serve the special burger on Fridays... hence the reason I went 2x in one weekend, lol!)  The only thing I noticed going two days in a row is that their rare/medium rare cooking is a little inconsistent. On Friday, the medium rare was already a little bloody. But on Saturday, the medium rare was different. Just something my boyfriend noticed. (I got rare both times and had no complaints.)  I also wish they validated parking!

IAl1sQ6mK2IOb0gMLPp4Qw.text: This restaurant is located on a busy corner on Mill.  It's a rowdy area with lots of foot traffic and I would not recommend that you get here by driving.  I'm sure there's a parking lot nearby somewhere but I didn't spot it.  Booths are short and comfortably seat 4.  I ordered the mushroom and Swiss burger done medium with a side of sweet potato tots.  The burger comes with your choice of traditional brioche, wheat, or pretzel bun; all are excellent choices.  The waitress recommended the Chipotle aioli instead of Ketchup and I'm glad she did; it was a novel and delicious flavor pairing.   Overall a delicious burger and large portions.  I had a bite of their fettucine alfredo which comes with buttered toast, but I would recommend against it.  If you're going to come here, then you should definitely get a burger!

NVgMu75_ZsLv_zBwQf0Fgw.text: Went here for a beer while waiting on my daughter and photographer, who were doing her senior photos on the ASU campus and downtown Tempe.  Great selection of beers to choose from, despite being out of the first two options I selected.  After the photoshoot was done, we went in to grab a couple burgers to go and have another beer. t-8zDsSt9igyIuJg5OkJnQ.text: I was stoked to check out Rehab--I'd heard really great things about it from a handful of people, it's close to my house, and they offer happy hour every day for those jabronies who work M-F, 9-5 (don't worry, I'm definitely one of these jabronies). But the experience as a whole was pretty underwhelming.   So to begin with, Rehab is on a pretty busy corner of Mill. Totally fine, and not at all a complain, just something to note if you're planning on driving. The restaurant itself is pretty spacious, with a huge bar, plenty of inside tables, and a sizable patio--bonus points for tons of TVs so you can shout at your favorite sports team from wherever you're seated.   We came here late afternoon on a Saturday, so it wasn't very busy at all. In fact, there seemed to be equal number of patrons and employees in the building. We were immediately seated and our drink orders taken pretty quickly; all standard stuff. But then our waiter didn't come back to take our food orders for probably another 15 minutes. Would've been fine and understandable if they were busy, but they definitely were not at all. After placing our food order, it didn't come out for another 40 minutes. What? It's a couple o' burgers. Again, would've made sense if they were slammed, but we were one of a dozen tables in there. Our server was very nice, but overall we were pretty disappointed by the lack of attention... And we are not typically people who want a whole ton of chattin' with our servers.   As for the burgers themselves, they were fine. I had the Mac Gnarly, a pretty simple burger in comparison to the rest of the menu, but I was feelin' it. I got the relapse (smaller) size because I am a small human, and it was still a ton of food for me. And super messy, but I can't hold my lack of grace against Rehab. It was a perfectly fine burger, just nothing particularly special. I feel like if I'm ever going to pay $10+ for a burger, I'm expecting it to knock my socks off. It was just fine. And a little bit closer to well done than my request for medium doneness, but that's not a huge deal. The fella had the Know Poblano on a gluten free bun. He had a pretty similar summation of it: perfectly fine, but not mind-blowing. He did, however, say it was one of the better gluten free buns he's ever had.   I will say that I really enjoyed the fries. Seasoned, but not too salty, and very crispy but still with a good amount of potato in there, they were very tasty. Pro tip: dip 'em in dat chipotle mayo. The sweet poTOToes were also tasty, and I don't generally care for them.   Overall, we were just expecting more from Rehab. Maybe we just happened upon an off day for them, but it's hard not to be a little bummed to pay a little more than standard for a burger that's a little lacking. At this price point, I'll be sticking to Cold Beer and Cheeseburgers.

yT9yjnaNW2fCya4N33IQ7w.text: I don't think I've ever been addicted to a burger joint before. I've never categorized myself as a "burger person". This place has converted me! I've decided one of my life goals is to try every burger on the menu.   So far my favorite is the PB&J bacon burger--it sounds insane, but it's just insanely good! The Mac and Cheese burger is bomb too! I love the pretzel bun. Sweet potato tots with their special sweet sauce is heaven. The fries are delicious too, so either choice is a win. You can eat lighter and choose healthy subs like a salad for your side, and a smaller patty with a whole wheat bun.  Last time I was there, I wasn't sure what I wanted to drink before heading out to a comedy show with friends. I just knew it was cold outside, I was getting sick, and I needed a boost of energy. The bartender custom made my drink: coffee, peppermint liqueur, whiskey, and whipped cream. It was one of the best Winter drinks I've ever had! Every server I've encountered here seems to enjoy working here, they are helpful figuring out what to order and always friendly.   The bathroom offers fresh hand towels, perfect for freshening up after a hike at nearby ASU mountain. Reggae/rock music for an awesome island vibe. A full bar, outdoor seating, and tucked away from the noisy nightlife of Mill Ave, but close enough too all the action that DT Tempe has to offer.   I'm hooked! You just have to try it!

RMcuZjDLDUWjtYdkBsEUkg.text: Love the overflowing tater tots. My fave by far. Sometimes I use the big Baba Booey soup spoon to just scoop up about 6-7 per bite-nothing beats mouthful after mouthful of tater tots. I pretend I'm eating a giant bowl of oatmeal, only it's tater tots.

0CcCeGU37AZ4wqo9s7l1sA.text: In town for a long weekend with ma' boys for spring training.  Dodger game was sold out so we wound up going to the Giants game which is a few blocks from Old Town Scottsdale.  Snuck out of the game in the top of the 8th because all the starters we're out.  Wandered those few blocks back into town and stumbled into Burger Rehab Therapy.  Got a table just in time as the "after game rush" was a few minutes behind us.  The place was buzzing.  Staff was pleasant, fun and attentive.  Reasonably priced drinks were ordered, served quickly, and tasted wonderful.  Second round was ordered immediately and again served in a flash.  For me, music can add or subtract from a dining experience. For this encounter it was a big plus.  Good classic rock & roll, the Stones, U2, the Eagles, and for good measure they threw in some Beach Boys.  The only thing missing was Stairway to Heaven and Free Bird. The place was filling up fast with the "tardy goers" but I didn't notice any change in the pace at which our troop was being taken care of.  We reviewed the menu and discussed the many choices with each other as well as the servers.  They were happy to outline the choices in detail and include the "extras" locals (not us) usually enjoy.  This was a big help in deciding.  Among the squad we wound up going all burger.  No shrubs or calamari for these cavemen.  Again the service was stellar.  Quick and on point. Burgers were cooked as ordered.  The man-boys had the Porkster, the Hangover and the B.Y.O.B. We had onion rings, skin-on fries, sweet potato tater tots and Jamaican Corn.  I went way off the radar and had the PB& J Bacon Burger on Brioche.  Oh my word! It was sloppy. It was sweet. Couple that with bacon, cheese and a well cooked beef patty and it was hands down the craziest and one of the best burgers I have had in a long time.  It was a sticky, sweet, savory, tasty, mess of a burger. I felt I needed to take a shower afterwards because that peanut butter was everywhere.  Even found a little behind my ear the next day at the Angels game.  I wholeheartedly recommend this place to anyone that wants to relax, enjoy a good meal, enjoy some music and make new friends.  Can't wait for spring training 2019.  Save a taco, eat a burger!

Bqqf8y0POiGcBtKmEO_Eug.text: Oh my gosh! Burgers are giant! And so was the club sandwich I had. The fries were awesome, love fries with the skin on. Just wasn't crazy about the sitting. Wish they had more booths. But the long table counter type doesn't create much eating enjoyment because kinda impersonal. The prices were very good  considering the amount of food you get. I would come back.

iQt9_-CjEf-XWNFMRrEQqg.text: ***Update 2019.7.11*** It's been a while since I've been here because I live farther away but I convinced my co-workers to try it out. I had the spicy Mac& cheese burger again and it was just as great I'd as I remember it being.   Also, our waitress (the one with short dark hair and a pretty smile) was great.  *****************  I've been trying to get over to this place since I moved to Arizona 2 years ago.  Starting off I think the beach bar was fun and not over the top with the surf boards and Tiki bar decor. I noticed a very reasonably sized bar right when we walked in which is very convenient if you just want drinks and a little food.  The place was packed and we only had to wait a bit because all the low tables were in use and we had someone in a wheelchair with us. It wasn't too long of a wait and the food would have made a longer wait worth it.  I'm a beer snob so the selection was pedestrian at best but their specialty drinks and hard liquor selection makes up for the lack of high end beers (I didn't show up for the booze though).  We ordered the pig wings appetizer which were melt in your mouth good. We ate the appetizer so fast that the timing for the main entree seemed long but was, in reality, reasonable.   I ordered the spicy mac n cheese 10oz burger and fries with the pretzel bun. My first thought when the plate arrived was that the food pics I've seen match the grandeur with which I was presented. Also, my burger was cooked medium which may be too much. Next time medium rare (and I usually like meat well done). I also think that the 5oz option is more sensible unless you are 20 years old and really hungry. The fries with the chipotle ranch were cooked well and complimented the whole meal ( I didn't have that "I loved the burger hate the fries experience I was expecting"). There was even a huge tasty dill pickle spear served on the side.  The next burger on my list will be the PB&J with Sriracha.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Tempe, AZ, United States. Had the spicy Mac and cheese and substituted the patty for a veggie patty with half fries and half sweet potatoes

7ciY8RQNdokFyCz-Q_ikZQ.text: I was excited to try their Hatch burger since I love me some Hatch chilis. Alex, the bartender, was super friendly and attentive. It's clear that all the staff here care a lot about their customers' well-being. I got the Hatch burger with a turkey burger since I don't eat beef. The burger was super juicy and flavorful. I was impressed as most turkey burgers at burger places don't seem to have much of a personal touch to them. I however wished there was a bit more heat, as I didn't find the chili wrapping the burger or the chipotle aioli very spicy. Luckily, they had lots of other hot sauces available.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Tempe, AZ, United States. Going to rehab!
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Tempe, AZ, United States. Hatch chili burger with a turkey patty

1z3N_tVuZKaZddRCsCIwIA.text: These burgers are TO DIE FOR!!! I'm always excited to visit PHX specifically for this reason. The burgers are so unique and taste like non other. Service is usually pretty good, and location is perfect. If you're looking for massive amounts of flavor in your burger, try the PB &J burger. This baby is bomb!!!

jXx3JZzIcuNsYQinoMwXYQ.text: I've had this place bookmarked for a really long time & was craving a burger one night. So my girl and I decided to stop into here.   We started off with the philly chz fries (half order). & oh my goodness, they were freakin fireeee. I could have just gotten this as my meal & would have been completely satisfied haha.   I decided to order the spicy mac n chz burger, rehab size. And my girl got the Hawaiian burger, same size. These burgers were so much better than what I expected them to be. And they're so huge! When our food got to the table, I thought to myself that I should of just ordered the relapse size because the rehab was so much bigger that I thought it would be. Both burgers were really good. Cooked to order. Great flavor as well.  Their fries on the other hand are just bomb in general. They out some type of seasoning on them that make them so delicious. We were trying to figure out what kinda seasoning it was but it definitely was something different from anything we've ever tried before. It had a tangy lime salt taste to them but they were really good.   Service was great. Parking can be a pain though!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Tempe, AZ, United States. Spicy Mac &amp; Chz Burger. Rehab sz
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Tempe, AZ, United States. Philly Chz Fries!

y6pHvt_lLHCuuQ5N0h_Uhg.text: We expected a lot more from this place. There's a lot of exciting looking burgers on the menu but when ours came out they kind of fell flat on flavor. The tots were meh. The service was good and prompt but the overall experience just left us unimpressed. Fine spot to try out but considering there are so many options there, probably somewhere we won't go back to.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Tempe, AZ, United States. 10 oz. Rehab Spicy Mac-N-Cheese Burger 5 oz. Relapse Backyard BBQ Burger

8r-n9Kwt4HywyKftf3idkg.text: This place had clean tables, a nice staff, food was good, not great and their burgers are definitely not $10 burgers as they charge. Two people cost us over $40! They are $6 burgers at most. Never going back there again solely because their prices aren't justified. I can eat much better, less greasy, higher quality food for $45.

Ef235TWYQqKfCHWK8ONcZw.text: Mmmmmm - delicious burgers and pretty cool ambiance. We had the jalapeno popper burger and my guy had the Hawaiian burger. We enjoyed both along with chips & salsa.  The wait was a little too long and I noticed my burger was a little cold but server was friendly and attentive so we didn't mind.   The outside seating was great too! We live in Seattle so we totally enjoyed the opportunity to hang outside while we ate our yummy burgers.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Tempe, AZ, United States

qRwxTmFA7Rywopiiiqk6og.text: Every time I have come here I have left very satisfied with my meal, my drinks and the customer service. Rehab is right in downtown Tempe where it gets a little crazy in the evening's with the college nearby and it's a party scene in this area most nights. Parking can be hard to find, or you can pay for parking in the garage that's within walking distance. The food is amazing. The burger with mac n cheese is a bit of a mess to eat but such a great gluttony menu item. I tried a few other burgers/sandwiches and the chicken wings are really good here too. There's a full bar and several beers on tap. The decor makes you feel like your near the beach. Overall this is a must try..

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Tempe, AZ, United States. Spicy mac-n-cheese burger, yummmm..
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Tempe, AZ, United States

HmfOVhMFlwyGsi7Y1qqHRA.text: How does that Amy Winehouse song go? Tried to make me go, but I said no no no?   My four colleagues and I stopped in for a lunch break, at the special request of one particular burger-loving guy who seriously needs therapy. Interior decor was funky, the menu looked great, and we were excited to get down to ordering and devouring.   We made quick decisions of a grilled cheese with pepper jack and side salad with chipotle ranch (me), spicy chicken wings with fries, Philly cheeseburger, and jalapeno popper burger with tots. That's where our high ended and the downer kicked in.   Sadly, we waited and waited and waited for about 25 minutes for our food to arrive. This was weird because there were only like 4 tables with patrons at that point, and a couple people sitting at the bar. By the time our food arrived, we need to run out the door in order not to be late for a meeting (which we still were, darn it). As the food was delivered, we immediately boxed up our plates to go, and then still had to wait for the check.   When I finally got to eat my GC, I was disappointed by the ratio of bread (way too thick) to cheese (way too little just melted in the middle). The salad was fine. My meat-loving colleague was pleased with his enormous cheesesteak burger, spilling out the sides of the bun. My other colleagues were disappointed not to be able to eat their meals hot and fresh, rather from the to-go container on the run and cooled.  Our server was nice and I don't blame her for the ridiculously long wait (not sure what was going on back in the kitchen). But also, she never came back to give us any status updates. It really would've been nice to know the timeframe rather than sitting there feeling forgotten and frustrated. We could have ordered a beer or an appetizer to pass the time and satiate our hunger. Alas, nada.   I had higher hopes, but this rehab 1-step program worked and I won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Tempe, AZ, United States. Jalapeño popper burger with tots.
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Tempe, AZ, United States. Sombrero piñata hanging from a tandem bike hanging from the ceiling? Sure, why not.
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Tempe, AZ, United States. Bar.

njYOWVxBiVtfoPYx_IDjTA.text: I work in the area and walked by here a few times and every time it always smells so delicious. I decided to stop in and try it. Man am I glad I did the burger was cooked to perfection. I will definitely make this place a regular lunch time grab for me. 10 out of 10 would recommend you to try this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Tempe, AZ, United States. Delicious

G5q7mxOGavgHDrFR8IERoQ.text: This was the most mediocre burger I've ever had. No flavor at all. To start, I asked my waiter for a few straws and he took them out of the wrapper and put his hands all over it and then put them in our drinks. Out of three of us, no one enjoyed our meal. Not to mention one of us got like double the fries, sucks bc that was the only good thing on my plate. Also the parking situation is terrible. It's $6 and if you forget your ticket you're screwed. My other dining partner had to get a new ticket and paid $12 for parking. More than the burger even was and it wasn't worth it. If you want a decent burger for a third less of the price, go to Chuckbox down the road. Free parking and a muchhhhh better burger.

H0vDIZ-SK5dCl7mL4M9CNA.text: Holy hamburger! These burgers are great! We have been to the Scottsdale location in the past and were having a staycation weekend nearby this location so we decided to drop in for dinner. There was no wait when we arrived although it was early (around 4pm). We were seated immediately and our drink order was taken quickly.  Everything we had was delicious. One of the burgers we ordered was massive! Only my husband was able to finish all his dinner the rest of us had leftovers. Everyone left full and happy. If you are in the area you should drop in for a bite to eat!

13kMsaPbzMd7-HT3LELNtw.text: Rehab Burger Therapy has some of the best sweet potato tater tots I have ever tasted and they are included with an entree purchase. Additionally, they have a huge selection of burgers on the menu. I had the 10oz Mac Gnarly burger which is their take on a Big Mac. The restaurant was pretty busy on a Saturday night even while school was out in the summer. I would go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Tempe, AZ, United States. 10oz Mac Gnarly Burger with Sweet Potato Tots

J2YKL5kd7suxlbAJ3qUCkA.text: I heard that this was the place to go for one of the best burgers in town. The burgers was pretty good but it would have been better if it was hot when it came out. You could tell that everything sat before it was brought out. The server even mentioned it when I had to ask him to bring out my child's grilled cheese sandwich. That definitely sat in the window for awhile. It was very clear that everything was being done when it was convenient for the server. Not when he had time but when he wanted to do it. It's too bad. The food was pretty good but with bad service it doesn't matter.

CI-ysbHdFwHNK9JbWEi7sw.text: Finally, after over a year of searching! We found our burger spot. I ordered a hatch green chile burger. Although the chile was mild, it had a spice to the taste which is more than any other chile served here in Phoenix.   Brad who is more adventurous ordered the spicy mac and cheese burger. WOW. The burger came out with a hefty serving of mac and cheese on top of the burger. Of course it had to have a pretzel bun. I tasted the mac and cheese and decided it was quite good.   The burger is a mix of several types of ground meats. Whatever the mix is, it works! I ordered my burger well done, since you can never be too careful with beef. Next time I will go with medium. This burger is that good. No need for worries. The meat is high quality. The fries that came with my burger were good. Skin on. Brad ordered onion rings. WOW WOW WOW! The onion is HUGE! The batter is light. You definitely need a fork and knife to eat these! They were the best we have tried in a long time.   For parking we parked in the garage on 6th/Mill. Short walk to Rehab.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Tempe, AZ, United States. Rehab at night
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Tempe, AZ, United States

dxu6uQ7DLLHSf3TolRDyfA.text: The waitress keara is the best waitress I have ever had. She is extremely well composed and friendly. I'm shocked she wasn't a manager!

l0ihST1ms1W0QorDZWMing.text: Burgers and hotdogs no so fabulous., the service and wings was good. I don't want to write more

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Tempe, AZ, United States

x7ZL6WLl0AJx5Eu-1VlJqg.text: Started out with the onion rings with various sauces  delicious! I was in heaven with the ghost cheese burger and the spicy Mac and cheese, it had fried red onions and some amazing sauce. Yum! Bring your appetite the burgers are Colossal.There was a 25 minute wait but me,my man, and our son ate every last morsel! Highly recommended

N_hR9CkKVADAy1GkzGjNCg.text: Although this location is closer to home, I still prefer the Scottsdale location. Staff is more friendly there. Our waitress seemed pissy. Food and beer was worth the attitude.

wqKJvKwOrtvBTntfyPsl5A.text: Food was super good! The sweet potato tots are amazing. The atmosphere is really fun as well. When I was there, the restaurant was pretty empty. Only about 2-3 other tables. Yet the food still took forever and service was slow! Overall rally good food but service isn't great.

UzI9jS-PxSQLQeNT2ZPxUw.text: This is my new favorite burger joint.  The BBQ burger was outstanding.  The 10 oz rehab patty was more than enough for 2 people.  The service was great as well.  Try this place, your going to love it.

N2IO8e6qCVnCibMX7efeFg.text: Horrible service today. Love the burgers but service was terrible and left with no food. Had the Aloha festival this weekend and thought I would get a burger instead of standing in long lines at the festival with my son. I sat down and ordered a burger right away. Server brought waters and never saw her again. Asked the hostess after 25min if the food was going to be longer and she said she would see. Another 10 minutes go by and still no one comes by or checks on us again. Ended up leaving after 35-40minutes. I could understand if it was busy but there were only two other tables with people at them in the front and only couple people outside. Don't think I'll go back again after being disappointed by the service.

MgwsU0-z2102p0uf6gpuyg.text: The bacon cheeseburger was very good except the bacon. Even though it had good flavor, it was closer to beef jerky than bacon. My friends swiss mushroom burger was killer. Other buddy's gargonzola bacon burger wasn't. The cheese and the bacon were suppose to be in the beef paddy but we never saw either. We got a side of onion rings and they were very tasty but they had more hard breading than I like. I prefer a thinner more delicate  breading.  The fries were top notch; nothing to complain about.  Over all, if you are in the mood for a great big burger and fries, you can't go wrong with Rehab.

HBMdgLbg0r93wIjysX-dTQ.text: I called ahead to make sure they were open today because last time we got there and they were closed on Mondays. We only had about an hour for 2 of the 6 of us. We got seated right away and got some iced tea and Diet Coke right away but it took at least 10 minutes to get some waters after I flagged the waitress down for the other 4 that met up with us. The server sat us at the big table for 6 but the last 4 people took a couple MInutes to find the place after having a little trouble with the underground parking garage and street meter. Not very convenient for those driving in. We paid 6 dollars for the underground parking and there is no validation. The parking garage must be owned by the city or privately. The food was pretty good but I've had better. The music was loud. It was hard to hear each other. The decor was very cute. The prices were decent for the prime location in downtown Tempe. It's a good thing our son asked for his salad in a to go container because it didn't come out until he had to leave. Service was slow, especially for July when ASU isn't even in session. Seemed like at least 20 to 30 minutes after we ordered that we got our food. We tried it but i don't think we will be back. Nice people though

RoVl03bjgWNbfkMwpr6X0g.text: Great service, great menu, great quality. In town for few days. Took a shot from Yelp! suggestions. Highly recommend. Only thing - if I had to find one....I got a choice between a 5 ounce and a 10 ounce burger. I chose the ten because the five was just too small for a guy my size. Whoa nelly, that was a hunk of meat. Probably more than I needed. But boy, I left there well fed and happy. Also, my wife got the black bean burger. Said it was about the best she's ever had.

KLhlNvETL_Tbzy_ym_GPfA.text: The Rehab "Hangover" burger is awesome. Cool spot and super friendly staff! You won't be disappointed whatsoever.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Tempe, AZ, United States

hOurD_9vJencsB0nkVBUGw.text: Pretty good burger! The meat was really tender. Of course I asked for it rare but it tasted delicious and wasn't rubbery like some red meat tends to be. Delicious sauces they add to the burger and pretty good fries. They're very salty which I love!

9lsA3ssRk53fAQcTCH2EAg.text: The food was alright. We ordered chips and salsa they never came. The waitress took it off the bill. I had the pulled pork, the bun was soggy and there was no taste of pineapple in any of the sauces. There was too much meat on the sandwich when it came but that's just personal preference.  The sweet potatoes tots were disgusting, and soggy. Perhaps they were undercooked. The place was crowded and very noisy.

AvP_USQJA2ksj9mzW8uaCg.text: For a quick snack before going to the Tour de Fat, my son and I stopped here.  We didn't get any burgers, though all of the ones and the rest of the food I saw looked very good. I'll probably go back to try one. Instead we had a couple of beers and the Calamari app. Being strips I was hoping for some thick cut, lightly bread, tender morsels. Instead we got thin short pieces, heavily breaded and very over cooked. Include a Marinara sauce that is so thick it's takes a spoon to dig it out of the bowl, and you've got meal frustration galore. We ended up asking for some Ranch and Blue Cheese dressing instead which help a great deal. Though to be very honest, a spicy thinner sauce, like a Thai Chili or even a good Salsa would have been much better. The server was great though she took her time getting to us and checking on us as we ate. If you go, try a Burger. They looked like the best option for something satisfying.

vq7bJbO_1jcj83BmZQ409w.text: Ate here after 3 months of hardcore dieting and I couldn't have made a better choice to expand my waistline. Ended up with the pulled-pork burger but was really debating the mac & cheese situation. Had to eat my food with a fork and I was all delicate and soft and small after 3 months of salads but I managed to put that delicious wreck down into my gut. So amazing.   Boyfriend go their weekend special, the Elvis. It sounded really awful, being topped with a Hershey Bar, Reeces Cup, and like peanut butter &  jelly... but it was stinkin' great. Holy fricken cow.   Drinks are waaay expensive (weeak Coronaritas) but honestly you wonder why you even got a drink as soon as they put the food down... no room for beer!

NrYKTWs066YBM8qu8LfIOg.text: Ok, if you are looking for something healthy here just don't. That being said , one of the best burgers I've ever had!  I got the Porkster and it was insane. BBQ on top of the patty, inside a delicious pretzel bun with sweet potato tots on the side. Pretty sure my life expectancy dropped 5 years after eating it but I would do it again tomorrow. Every bite of everything I ate was heavenly.  Definitely give it a try! I didn't give it a 5 because nobody is perfect but it's very close for what it is!

ICk8a2PDMVguaflHGHPJ0Q.text: Will continue to come to RBT for as long as they stay around. Great portions and great quality burgers and sides. Great place to eat at, anytime of the day!

J47Yo_NdBGxIc3ApMl0-AA.text: I have been saving this place for a special occasion. Well 18 pounds lost, and I am so happy I left this for my celebratory meal! We ordered the green Chile appetizer and it is a must! A tad spicy but full of flavor! I ordered the Spicy Chili Mac & Cheese burger and although it was still amazing... the Mac and cheese lacked flavor and not really spicy. But, the burger patty being perfectly cooked and seasoned made up for it. Their Coron-Rita is strong but super good! Overall a great place, nice and attentive staff. I'll definitely be back to try their infamous PB&J burger!

ppMhe8quEeT7TkI4Wywvrw.text: Super satisfying gourmet, fresh burgers. The ambience is relaxing. Service is great. The food tastes like its from scratch. Prices are reasonable.
