Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Tempe, AZ, United States. Corona-rita which is a mix of Margarita and Corona. Interestingly enough, the bottle also reads Coronita.

uP6y_KBQ3v7l6Zk1SC_cfQ.text: Super bomb but wanted one of these awesome burgers after 9pm! Gotta stay open later, you're on mill!

X3bx4r3XYh_gc4S2c5W0wA.text: They all know me at the bar. Save today no one has ever rubbed me the wrong way.  The pb&j burger is amazing. I always come back

f2JcB2KKdriNt2U-tcMP0A.text: The table was too tall for us tiny gals but the burger.. wow! Yum. PB&J won my heart. The decor had a very relaxing and casual atmosphere, kinda sporty. The staff was very friendly, and prompt. It was a very clean place, and it felt good having some water (like 10 glasses) of it on a hot day while waiting for my coke, and my wifes beer. The selection of burgers was nice and large, and while we shared the PB&J, others jumped out at us too. We will definiately be back now that we live in the area!

D-o7gzXBtMQDKErs4E97dA.text: Sat down with my family of four ( only three of us ordered) on a very empty Sunday afternoon. Took an hour and fifteen minutes for us to get our three burgers, and they were room temperature by the time we received them. Little to no service sitting outside, and very high pricing of around $15/person for average quality food.

Nc4t-46mdI0DFGNjQGP4BA.text: The size of the burgers and variety is incredible even the dipping sauces but the flavor even with all of that said just wasn't worth paying for it's price. Still just for it's sheer unique characteristics of the kinds of food I'd recommend people to at least come once.

3vul7w-mgMnGo73hPCoGBQ.text: They were out of everything which was pretty sad. One type of cheese one type of bun Only spicy bacon. We sat outside and service was HORRIBLE. Also both drinks i got served we're bad seemed as if they need to change their soda. One of the managers still worked hard to try and fix what our server wasn't doing. Waiting about 10 minutes before our drinks were taken then only saw our server again once. Also my food came out incorrect and after I said something they said it is because they were out of regular bacon..... Wish they would of told me before the fact

jWq01kmRs6K7E_boE87yzw.text: Good burgers, but super greasy! The French fries were alright but nothing too great. Good customer service though

lZU5npWZkPS9z6yxcqsGKA.text: Rehab Burger is one of my favorite burger places in the valley. The food is delicious, the staff is friendly, and the environment is inviting. I have been to the Scottsdale location as well and everything is the same. The only reason why i did not give this a 5 Star is because I requested to have no jalapenos and green chilies on my Mac N Cheese burger, and the waiter gave my another customers Mac N Cheese hamburger with the green chilies still in it. To be honest it was not that big of a deal and the place was not busy at all.

-TDP391N-VOLAUjTVmY_8g.text: We are a huge fan of the Scottsdale location, so decided to foray into Sun Devil territory to check out the new location.  It's bigger, but louder.  We are used to loud, but it wasn't that crowded yet and had to repeat ourselves a lot.   Same amazing menu.  My favorites include their Pig Wings, and Hawaiian Burger. We love their sweet potato tots. A nice feature is selecting your dipping sauces. We like their pineapple teriyaki aoli.  Patrick's favorite menu item is the PB&J burger.   We love the option of two sizes of burgers and salads. Relapse vs Rehab.   On a whim we tried a different burger. It was our first time ordering the Pablano burger.  It had spicy onions on it, which were a little overwhelming.  But otherwise very tasty.   The service was great.  Good teamwork. I love that they want your food to come out the way you want it and sincerely check on your satisfaction.    We will be back.

GyilE_S8gOtZIKwsc88JsA.text: I find myself coming back to this restaurant as it is a great place to go for lunch (and study). I had the relapse B.Y.O.B with lettuce and onions and it was one of the most delicious and juiciest burgers that I have had. The seasoning was tasty and the burger was cooked to perfection. The fries were also amazing - thick, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.

lGeDG-MJuOgcEU7RcDsATw.text: I just ordered a delivery, the driver is on time and the burgers taste good. The problem is they dont know how to follow simple instructions, i said separate the veggies and cut the burger in half. But its not what i received. Also the fries are too soggy.

mJnAYhBUrKqOaYOpB2twKQ.text: I love the crazy burgers you can get here.  We asked the waiter for recommendations and he said that as crazy as it sounds the PB&J bacon burger is a top seller.  I went for it and it was good.  I would like to try it again.  The burgers are very large and filling and the service is good.  I have tried 3 other weird burgers here and they have all been great.

3cIIus7zgbwYm2YVy735cw.text: I travel for work and always try to hit local places. Took the recommendation of the waiter to try the PB&J burger with bacon and sriracha. It was amazing. An odd combination of flavors that work. Place has a cool laid back vibe and lots TV's. I highly recommend it if you are in the area. A great find for this business traveler!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Tempe, AZ, United States

JqxVcF3YqNJ1ME682wCuCA.text: I like that you have a choice in size of burger. There is a wide variety of burger options. I had to try the PBJ Bacon burger. It did not disappoint! Portion sizes are plentiful and waitstaff is very friendly as well as good at offering suggestions.

U9IJDycKmsi1hlham5J_Ow.text: Thoroughly enjoy Rehab. Have previously been to Scottsdale location but this was first time to Mill Ave location. Our waitress was amazing. The moment she heard my wife suffered from Celiac disease she knew right what my wife cpuld amd couldn't eat. Very attentive, very helpful, had an opinion and shared it. Her follow up was great. Burgers and sweet poTOToes were delicious and cooked well. Flavors were on point and meat was cooked to order. Will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Tempe, AZ, United States. Date night at Rehab Burger!

qID7uCuZjkQP2-KnVOI0jA.text: Came in on a random afternoon and their burgers surprised me. Never thought a PB&J burger would taste so good!!

1sCh-izTBV-1mDR-I24FKg.text: I've been to the Scottsdale location but this was our first time to Tempe Rehab. It was Thursday all day Happy Hour so we enjoyed a couple of Four Peaks drafts for a decent price. My wife's Hatch Burger (she got the relapse size - 5 oz) was outstanding. The chile on top was grilled, with a bit of smoky flavor. I opted for the Hawaiian burger (rehab size - 10 oz). It was huge with a large grilled pineapple slice on top.   I had ordered it well done and, unfortunately, it came out still very red throughout. If it had been close I would have normally accepted it but I had to send it back. The waitress apologized and quickly took the burger back. I kept the plate of fries so I would have something to nibble on while I was waiting. A couple of minutes later, the manager came out and apologized about the mixup. She offered me a side salad or something while I waited. Because I had the fries I declined. She also said, "of course, when you get your burger back this will be on me." The manager also came around a few minutes later to refill our water glasses. A few minutes later the waitress came by to say the burger would only be another couple of minutes. When it arrived it was cooked perfectly.   I'm going into a lot of detail about this because this is how you want to be treated when things don't go right. I did not expect to be comp'ed for the burger but it was a really nice touch. BTW, the burger was delicious, especially with the pineapple teriyaki aioli.  I'm not a gourmet and so as long as the food tastes good, the thing that matters most to me is the service. This one was top notch.

TZHTK2hD15fajcaEmvFowA.text: Loved the jalepeno popper burger with no bun!  Huge portions of everything.  Our server Madeline was friendly and helpful.

uJVO0CbVMphJaqGE5jdTcg.text: If you want a great burger and fries with an awesome environment, then look no further!  RBT is the place to gather, drink, and visit with friends and family.  The food at Rehab Burger Therapy is one of the best I've ever had and the atmosphere ties everything together--highly recommended!

5JjGwQAGprhAANt1iH6Sew.text: We were looking for somewhere new to try so we came to Rehab Burger Therapy last night. It was Saturday about 7. We were welcomed and got seated right away. It took about 10 minutes for anyone to come over to our table to ask about drinks or anything. We ordered a chili burger, build your own burger and a hot dog. The chili was very plain with lots of tomatoes. I'd have to say this is the first restaurant where my kids didn't devour the French fries. They have an odd seasoning salt of them.  The food was okay. I thought the prices were reasonable. The service could have been better. Our server was super nice. Overall super slow. We may try again, not sure. Definitely worth at least trying once.   The easiest way to find is to access 6th street off of Mill Ave.  They are next to the parking garage.

029NBIuXbFYa6z17izmwfw.text: This is one of my favorite burger places in Tempe! Their sweet potatoes tots are so tasty and you get your money's worth with the HUGE portions. Their drink list is also delicious, and I would recommend the Mai Tai!

hPfuX0x-CsnpFCqMPuygNw.text: I arrived on Thursday night it was not busy which surprised me.  They have happy hour all night on Thursdays.  I ordered a spicy Mac burger and it was huge and very good!   You have a variety of sides and dipping sauces.  I chose the sweet potato tots and could not pick a sauce so the bartender brought me his four favorite.  They were all good!   The staff was very friendly.

KuQQNr449dbXW5S5BaVSXg.text: Swell place indeed!  Awesome staff and holy gamoley! Crazy burgers! Our party had a little bit of everything. .. Sweet potatoe tots with ALL the dipping sauces  Onion rings Macaroni and cheese Macaroni and cheese burger Mushroom and swiss Hangover burger Jalapeno popper burger.   Summer Shandy on draft as well :)   All quite splendid!

Mu85e0yODHRJZA3WFY6ABA.text: The burger here did not disappoint. Hubby and I were in the area and have wanted to visit this restaurant for awhile now so we were pretty excited. The restaurant was not very busy to our surprise. We decided to share the ghost burger with fries. The plate was definitely enough for two because the burger itself was pretty big. Our server was also pretty friendly. Very happy we tried it. I definitely recommend if you are in the area.

JlunisMkbizShILbGsJ0oA.text: I have a love hate relationship with Rehab. First time I went I thought it was the best of the best and then it wasn't. I have been chasing that experience ever since. Today I had the special Meatloaf Mash and it was the bomb! It needs a permanent place on the menu.   The 10oz burgers (or larger) are infinitely better tasting in my opinion. They are more flavorful and more moist. I order medium rare and the 5oz always seems dry. I almost quit going, but you know...chasing that first date fun is a hard thing and I couldn't give up. And of course the 10oz are too damn big for an average human, hence my love hate relationship. However, due to this issue we have discovered a few other treats they have to offer and highly recommend both the tuna and the club.   Oh and the sweet potato fries with teriyaki pineapple sauce means you don't even need to order dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Tempe, AZ, United States. Meatloaf Mash

f4M_-zqwYAi8-lKlc-ijJQ.text: Burgers are creative and big! Came with a large group and the service was great. Really enjoyed the music they played and overall it was a nice restaurant.   I can't say that I'd come back just because the burgers didn't have great flavor. I got to try at least 4 off the menu as well and in this case, bigger isn't always better.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Tempe, AZ, United States. Mac and cheese burger

f4M57k2X22YJME9rauSVAA.text: Came here for a brunch/dinner spot that had a happy meal menu.  This place is large, has an outdoor and indoor seating area.  Servers were nice and attentive, spending time answering our questions.   They took care of our needs with haste. We ordered sweet potato fries, regular fries, and onion rings as well as a margatini.  potatoe fries I didn't care for.  The sauce didn't make it any better as well, which is disappointing.  The fries and onion rings were good, nice and crunchy but not oily at all.  The sauces were good especially when mixed with the hot sauces they had there.  Then we ordered a to go ghost pepper burger which was really spicy.  Didn't care for that too much. The margarita was strong and hit the spot most definitely. Overall the vibe was nice.  Cool little hangout for th3 college kids there.  Service was excellent.  Food made it a 4 out 5 star rather than a 5 starbut overall it was q nice experience

HKHkzKL53dbp-P76v1Chmg.text: I love coming to this place. They always have reggae playing which I enjoy. The servings of food will never disappoint. I think your getting a huge bang for your buck as the quality is there, huge serving, and happy during the day makes it even better.

Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Tempe, AZ, United States

nGrqv-zPTDrUH0l_7pB4Fg.text: Overall had a pretty good experience here. The service we had was awesome. We came in on a Thursday night around 6 or 6:30 so it was pretty relaxed and wasn't all that slammed aside from a company party sitting at the middle table.   I had a Burger with a hatch chili on it and it was pretty good. One thing you always fear in burger shops in if they are going to cook your burger properly but mine was cooked perfect and so was the persons who came with me. The fries were good as well. Again no complaints.   I know you are probably thinking, well you didn't complain about anything so why not 5 stars? Well the food was good. But it didn't wow me or anything. The food was good for the price and the service was great. Not the best burger I have ever had and definitely not the worst.   The only caveat here is that if you are interested in just grabbing some food here it can be a bit of a pain because it is on Mill basically which means parking is extremely limited and you will more than likely have to pay to park to get here.   Again, overall good quality place.

bGNH6YRn31Rw4ZxjYfKhGA.text: My mom and I stopped by here for lunch while we were wondering around the Tempe Arts Festival. I've been to the Scottsdale location a couple of times, so I had high hopes that it would be pretty good. And we weren't let down! My mom ordered the Philly cheese steak burger and I got the mushroom and swiss burger. We both chose fries over the sweet potato tots. Both burgers were cooked to order and perfect! Service was friendly and they kept up on our drink refills too. This place has a very hawaiian vibe. It feels happy and beachy, I like it! Reminds me of San Diego, which I love. They have some really interesting burgers to choose from like the Mac&Cheese burger, the PBJ & Bacon burger or the Tracker Pulled Pork burger. Don't worry, they still have traditional burgers too or you can build your own. So, if you're on Mill Ave and really need a good burger fix, this place would be a great choice!

NVGad-VtylM0M0hesTGDOA.text: Came in at 11:15 am on a Friday. Started out NOT busy. Within 20 mins., it became quite busy and much noisier. Acoustics contribute to this. I'd say they have a good tasty worthy burger. There are options to satisfy the most finicky burger patron connoisseurs! Served on a very fresh lightly toasted bun. I opted for the regular nicely cut fries. Also, freshly made. You can have the REHAB 10 ozs.! Or, half that size, 5 ozs. (a RELAPSE). They didn't disappoint and the staff is friendly. The young waitress didn't seem all that familiar with their menu, but she was quite pleasant and apologetic for this. Table service was above average. Go when it's not peak hours for better service.

photos.caption: Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Rehab Burger Therapy - Tempe, AZ, United States

GgKTSqSTavmkd__lpCp_Ug.text: Oh.....my......god. The PB&J Burger was the best burger I've ever had in my life, I think. Peanut butter, Jelly, Siracha, and Bacon on a pretzel bun with a delicious, perfectly cooked patty. I think this place will be a regular stop when I'm in the Tempe area.  Not to mention, the service was good, and the vibe was relaxed and fun, reggae music playing loud enough to be fun, but not so loud to make conversation hard. We sat on the shaded patio and it was just great.

zUkK23jZUJHuzSuaH1rLmw.text: Finally got to this location yesterday.  Had to pay a meter to park out front.  Put in an hour but it took longer than that for lunch and dessert.  Had a smaller burger with blue cheese, avocado and a fried egg.  The egg should have been skipped.  I am an egg snob and this was neither a quality egg nor was it prepared well.  The rest including the tots and the dipping sauces was delicious.  For dessert we had the pot brownie with Reeses cup, peanut butter, marshmallow, ice cream and chocolate syrup.   So good the way you burn your mouth on some bites while cooling it with the ice cream at the same time.

4i1pEXcPqdhbBOUCWYJLrA.text: So of course I had to have a PB & J  burger and am I glad I did! So good so much interesting fun in every bite. Something they leave out of the title is that there is a small bit of sriracha mixed in and as crazy as all this sounds (peanut butter, jelly, sriracha, burger) it is SO GOOD. If you know anything about food experimentation, the oddest combinations make some good tastes. Cheese and chocolate, bacon and syrup, cottage cheese and chili cheese fritos. The PB & J Burger is up there with it! But this iconic burger is not the only thing to come here for, all their unique burger choices sound amazing. I literally had to ask the waitress to come back two different times because I was so undecided on what to get! They all look so good and so do the appetizers ( be warned though. The burgers are huge and filling so only order apps and burgers if you're really hungry or eat a lot usually). The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars was the decor is dated and just screams "Islands Burger knock off" and the tables around ours were pretty filthy and set for people to sit down.   Also, REHAB BURGER EXEC CHEFS: please make a 4-6-8 Slider plate that can serve almost as a taster so we don't have to decide on one of your delicious burgers but can try a multitude for different kinds (great for sharing too) so when I come back I won't have to gamble on a burger I may not like. Just a golden idea I'll pass along for free

xSFiiFf1LtWCcf16QRG4hA.text: Great burger place and fried were good!  Place was clean, service was a little slow for 2 PM in afternoon.  Would definitely go back next time I'm in town.

9zfTEDAuDGgmZsVpXOTb-g.text: Can you please roll me out to my car because my food baby is killing me!!! This location in Tempe is just as awesome as the location in Scottsdale. Great food (as always) and wonderful friendly staff. It is located right behind Casa, right off Mill. I think it is a great addition to Mil Ave. The inside feels a bit bigger than the Scottsdale location and they have an awesome outside covered patio. They kept the same menu and decor as their other location, which is perfect because if something isn't broke, don't fix it! Rehab, you guys are my #1 burger place! Keep it up! :)  PS if this is your first time here, get the smaller burger, because the larger ones ARE HUGE! I recommend the Jalapeno Popper burger or The Hangover burger. Their fries are scrumptious AND if you have a Gluten allergy ask for the Gluten free bun, it actually taste great!!!

Ii94JX7HBTTTRTof4acQ_w.text: Awesome food, the burger w meat shaved on time was huge. My husband could only get through half.

7SXrPCLj2_75MJU3zTf6dQ.text: Absolutely one of my favorite burger places! My buddy had the Macaroni and Cheese burger and I had the Jalapeno Popper Burger.  We both loved the toppings and the burgers themselves were great.  The Jamaican corn was very delicious with a nice smokey grilled flavor and a flavorful spice.  The sweet potato tots are amazing!  I loved everything I ate here.

2eCCFo_13ItsTdpxmFRYGA.text: So this is the second time I had gone to the Tempe location. We even had the same waitress, anyhow we had a great experience. My burger was cooked perfectly; med rare and I was astonished, since my last experience was not cooked to how I ordered. These guys especially our server made an incredible effort to make our experience great. Thanks guys and we will be back for sure

10ngTPZI2QCzaZ7Ydc9RRQ.text: I had the chili cheese 10 ounce burger with skin-on fries and a coke, Tues afternoon Oct. 9. The chili cheese was nearly tasteless. I ordered the burger cooked at medium and it was beyond well-done and totally dry. Same thing with fries. Nothing wrong with the coke.

cnkxQHgWpa92Ln2xEzYkYg.text: This place has such a chill vibe!! Always greeted warmly and gave great service. Burgers are giant of course, and plated very pretty - awesome photo op! Tasty tasty too!! Been several times and always can only eat half.. so if you can agree on a burger with someone, best to go splitskies. If you follow then on Facebook, you get the inside intel on the special weekend burger creation they always have- stay tuned, there's some pretty cool stuff! Both fries and sweet potato tater tots are fantastic, you won't go wrong with either! Keep up the great work, Rehab!!

cKDcLNRPx8V_Z4f7W3y_2g.text: Great atmosphere and excellent service.  There are so many burger variations to choose. So, I will keep coming back. Each one is a unique burger experience. Can't wait until my next visit.
